section.title: SERVICE: BACKUP in Other Services section

entry.para: Description: Service log directory consuming more disk than its quota.
Likely cause: The service log directory, as indicated by the path dimension, is over the 2.5 GB quota.

row.entry: Find the service that is consuming too much disk space. Look at the logs. If DEBUG log entries exist, set the logging level to INFO. If the logs are repeatedly logging an error message, do what is needed to resolve the error. If old log files exist, configure log rotate to remove them. You could also choose to remove old log files by hand after backing them up if needed.

row.entry: This alarm is verifying access to the Barbican API via the virtual IP address (HAProxy). If this check is failing but the other two HTTP Status alarms for the key-manager service are not then the issue is likely with HAProxy so you should view the alarms for that service. If the other two HTTP Status alarms are alerting as well then restart Barbican using the steps listed.

section.title: SERVICE: MYSQL in Other Services section

entry.para: Description: Alarms when the slow query rate is high.
Likely cause: The system load is too high.

row.entry: This could be an indication of near capacity limits or an exposed bad query. First, check overall system load and then investigate MySQL details.
